name: C. Chocolate Bunny
statement:
We hid from you a permutation p of length n, consisting of the elements
from 1 to n. You want to guess it. To do that, you can give us 2
different indices i and j, and we will reply with p_{i}
bmod p_{j} (remainder of division p_{i} by p_{j}).We have enough
patience to answer at most 2
cdot n queries, so you should fit in this constraint. Can you do it?As a
reminder, a permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct
integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the
array) and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the
array).
